name: The Entrance
desc: ‘Don't forget your drawler!’ she shouted. ‘I won't, mom!’ A little annoyed, Ezlo took it from the wall and went on to leave the house.

name: The Museum
desc: We found them close to the edge. They are so different from what we are used to. Did ‘they’ use this to measure their paths?

name: The Teapot
desc: Diana brought cake. Neither could I see her nor did I know if she actually existed, but still, I appreciated the gesture.

name: The Furniture
desc: I pushed back the chair and went to the shelf. Absorbed in the book in my hands, I, almost in trance, rotated the plant as usual.

name: The Wall
desc: “I don’t know anymore where I can go.” Marcus said. The floor collapsed below him while another appeared where the wall was before. Confused, he took a step to the side, or down, depending on the angle.

name: The Objects
desc: They were strange. I could not grasp what they were supposed to do. Some were levitating, but also weren’t, while others seemed boringly normal, but then behaved unexpected.

name: The Room
desc: My whole world happens within this room. Am I still inside? Is this the new outside? What does ‘outside’ even mean?
